intro: Lobelia alsinoides subsp. hancei, commonly known as the Chinese bluebell, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It features showy, tubular blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate regions.
